title.en: Biographies of Shu Lizi and Gan Mao
title.raw: 《樗里子甘茂列傳》 Biographies of Shu Lizi and Gan Mao

sentences.zh: 樗里子者，名疾，秦惠王之弟也，與惠王異母。

translations.literal: Shu Lizi, whose name was Ji, was King Hui of Qin's younger half-brother.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Lizi, whose given name was Ji, was the younger half-brother of King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 母，韓女也。

translations.literal: Their mother was a woman from Han.
translations.idiomatic: Their mother was a woman from Han.

sentences.zh: 樗里子滑稽多智，秦人號曰「智囊」。

translations.literal: Shu Lizi was witty and highly intelligent. The people of Qin called him the "Wisdom Bag."
translations.idiomatic: Shu Lizi was witty and exceedingly clever. The people of Qin dubbed him the 'Wisdom Satchel.'

translations.literal: Shu Lizi, named Ji, was Qin Hui Wang younger brother, different mother. Mother was Han woman. Shu Lizi slick witty multi-intelligent, Qin people called him wisdom bag.

sentences.zh: 秦惠王八年，爵樗里子右更，使將而伐曲沃，盡出其人，取其城，地入秦。

translations.literal: In the eighth year of King Hui of Qin, he enfeoffed Shu Lizi as Right Minister and sent him as general to attack Quwo. They expelled all its inhabitants, captured the city, and the territory came under Qin control.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year of King Hui of Qin, he enfeoffed Shu Lizi with the rank of Right Minister and dispatched him as general to attack Quwo. They drove out all its inhabitants, seized the city, and the territory fell under Qin's control.

sentences.zh: 秦惠王二十五年，使樗里子為將伐趙，虜趙將軍莊豹，拔藺。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year of King Hui of Qin, he sent Shu Lizi as general to attack Zhao. They captured the Zhao general Zhuang Bao and took the city of Lin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year of King Hui of Qin, he dispatched Shu Lizi as general to attack Zhao. They captured the Zhao general Zhuang Bao and seized the city of Lin.

sentences.zh: 明年，助魏章攻楚，敗楚將屈丐，取漢中地。

translations.literal: The next year, he assisted Wei Zhang in attacking Chu, defeated the Chu general Qu Gai, and took the territory of Hanzhong.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, he aided Wei Zhang in attacking Chu, defeated the Chu general Qu Gai, and seized the territory of Hanzhong.

sentences.zh: 秦封樗里子，號為嚴君。

translations.literal: Qin enfeoffed Shu Lizi and gave him the title Lord Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Qin enfeoffed Shu Lizi and bestowed upon him the title Lord Yan.

translations.literal: Qin Hui Wang eight years, enfeoffed Shu Lizi right more, made general attack Qu Wo, completely expel its people, take its city, land entered Qin. Qin Hui Wang twenty five years, made Shu Lizi general attack Zhao, captured Zhao general Zhuang Bao, took Lin. Next year, assisted Wei Zhang attack Chu, defeated Chu general Qu Gai, took Han Zhong land. Qin enfeoffed Shu Lizi, titled Yan Jun.

sentences.zh: 秦惠王卒，太子武王立，逐張儀、魏章，而以樗里子、甘茂為左右丞相。

translations.literal: When King Hui of Qin died, Crown Prince Wu ascended the throne as King Wu. He expelled Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang, and appointed Shu Lizi and Gan Mao as left and right chancellors.
translations.idiomatic: When King Hui of Qin died, Crown Prince Wu ascended the throne as King Wu. He banished Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang, and appointed Shu Lizi and Gan Mao as left and right prime ministers.

sentences.zh: 秦使甘茂攻韓，拔宜陽。

translations.literal: Qin sent Gan Mao to attack Han and capture Yiyang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin dispatched Gan Mao to attack Han and seize Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 使樗里子以車百乘入周。

translations.literal: They sent Shu Lizi with a hundred chariots to enter Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Shu Lizi with a hundred chariots to enter Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周以卒迎之，意甚敬。

translations.literal: Zhou welcomed him with troops, showing great respect.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou welcomed him with armed escort, showing utmost deference.

sentences.zh: 楚王怒，讓周，以其重秦客。

translations.literal: The King of Chu was angry and rebuked Zhou for favoring the Qin guest.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu grew furious and upbraided Zhou for favoring the Qin envoy.

sentences.zh: 游騰為周說楚王曰：「知伯之伐仇猶，遺之廣車，因隨之以兵，仇猶遂亡。

translations.literal: You Teng for Zhou advised Chu Wang: Zhi Bo attack Qiu You, sent him broad chariot, because followed with troops, Qiu You then perished.
translations.idiomatic: You Teng advised the King of Chu on Zhou's behalf: "When Zhi Bo attacked Qiuyou, he sent them broad chariots, then followed up with troops, and Qiuyou was destroyed.

sentences.zh: 何則？

translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Why so?

sentences.zh: 無備故也。

translations.literal: Because they were unprepared.
translations.idiomatic: Because they were unprepared.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公伐蔡，號曰誅楚，其實襲蔡。

translations.literal: When Duke Huan of Qi attacked Cai, he announced it was to punish Chu, but actually attacked Cai.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Huan of Qi attacked Cai, he proclaimed it was to punish Chu, but in truth he ambushed Cai.

sentences.zh: 今秦，虎狼之國，使樗里子以車百乘入周，周以仇猶、蔡觀焉，故使長戟居前，彊弩在後，名曰衛疾，而實囚之。

translations.literal: Now Qin is a land of tigers and wolves. If they send Shu Lizi with a hundred chariots into Zhou, Zhou will see it as Qiuyou and Cai did, so they will place long halberds in front and strong crossbows behind, calling it protection for Ji but actually imprisoning him.
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin is a realm of tigers and wolves. If they dispatch Shu Lizi with a hundred chariots into Zhou, Zhou will view it as Duke Huan did Qiuyou and Cai—so they will station long lances before him and strong crossbows behind, calling it protection for Ji but in truth imprisoning him.

sentences.zh: 且夫周豈能無憂其社稷哉？

translations.literal: Moreover Zhou how can not worry its state altars?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, how can Zhou not worry about its altars of soil and grain?

sentences.zh: 恐一旦亡國以憂大王。」

translations.literal: I fear that one day Zhou will perish as a state and bring worry to Your Majesty."
translations.idiomatic: I fear that one day Zhou will perish as a kingdom and cause anxiety for Your Majesty."

sentences.zh: 楚王乃悅。

translations.literal: The King of Chu was then pleased.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu was then appeased.

translations.literal: Qin Hui Wang died, crown prince Wu Wang established, expelled Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang, made Shu Lizi, Gan Mao left right chancellors. Qin made Gan Mao attack Han, took Yi Yang. Made Shu Lizi with hundred chariots enter Zhou. Zhou with troops welcome him, intention very respectful. Chu Wang angry, rebuked Zhou, for its heavy Qin guest. You Teng for Zhou advised Chu Wang: Zhi Bo attack Qiu You, sent him broad chariot, because followed with troops, Qiu You then perished. Why? No preparation therefore. Qi Huan Gong attack Cai, announced punish Chu, actually attack Cai. Now Qin, tiger wolf state, make Shu Lizi with hundred chariots enter Zhou, Zhou with Qiu You, Cai observe it, therefore make long halberds front, strong crossbows rear, named guard Ji, actually imprison him. Moreover Zhou how can not worry its state altars? Fear one day perish state to worry great wang. Chu Wang then pleased.

sentences.zh: 秦武王卒，昭王立，樗里子又益尊重。

translations.literal: When King Wu of Qin died and King Zhao ascended the throne, Shu Lizi's status became even more honored.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Qin died and King Zhao ascended the throne, Shu Lizi's esteem grew even greater.

translations.literal: Qin Wu Wang died, Zhao Wang established, Shu Lizi moreover increased honored.

sentences.zh: 昭王元年，樗里子將伐蒲。

translations.literal: In the first year of King Zhao, Shu Lizi led an attack on Pu.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Zhao, Shu Lizi commanded the assault on Pu.

sentences.zh: 蒲守恐，請胡衍。

translations.literal: The governor of Pu was afraid and sent for Hu Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The governor of Pu grew fearful and summoned Hu Yan.

sentences.zh: 胡衍為蒲謂樗里子曰：「公之攻蒲，為秦乎？

translations.literal: Hu Yan for Pu told Shu Lizi: Jun attack Pu, for Qin?
translations.idiomatic: Hu Yan spoke to Shu Lizi on behalf of Pu: "Is my lord attacking Pu for Qin's sake?

sentences.zh: 為魏乎？

translations.literal: For Wei?
translations.idiomatic: Or for Wei's?

sentences.zh: 為魏則善矣，為秦則不為賴矣。

translations.literal: If for Wei, that would be good; if for Qin, it would not be beneficial.
translations.idiomatic: If given to Wei, it would be advantageous; if given to Qin, it would be of no benefit.

sentences.zh: 夫衛之所以為衛者，以蒲也。

translations.literal: The reason Wei exists as Wei is because of Pu.
translations.idiomatic: The reason Wei endures as Wei is because of Pu.

sentences.zh: 今伐蒲入於魏，衛必折而從之。

translations.literal: If you now attack Pu and give it to Wei, Wei will surely submit to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: If you now attack Pu and cede it to Wei, Wei will surely break and submit to Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏亡西河之外而無以取者，兵弱也。

translations.literal: Wei lost the lands west of the Yellow River and has no way to recover them because their army is weak.
translations.idiomatic: Wei forfeited the territories west of the Yellow River and cannot reclaim them because their military is feeble.

sentences.zh: 今并衛於魏，魏必彊。

translations.literal: If you now give Wei to Wei, Wei will certainly become strong.
translations.idiomatic: If you now annex Wei to Wei, Wei will surely grow powerful.

sentences.zh: 魏彊之日，西河之外必危矣。

translations.literal: When Wei becomes strong, the lands west of the Yellow River will certainly be in danger.
translations.idiomatic: When Wei grows mighty, the territories west of the Yellow River will surely be imperiled.

sentences.zh: 且秦王將觀公之事，害秦而利魏，王必罪公。」

translations.literal: Moreover, the King of Qin will observe my lord's actions. If they harm Qin and benefit Wei, the king will certainly punish my lord."
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the King of Qin will scrutinize my lord's conduct. If it harms Qin and aids Wei, the king will surely condemn my lord."

sentences.zh: 樗里子曰：「柰何？」

translations.literal: Shu Lizi said: What to do?
translations.idiomatic: Shu Lizi asked, "What should I do?"

sentences.zh: 胡衍曰：「公釋蒲勿攻，臣試為公入言之，以德衛君。」

translations.literal: Hu Yan said: Jun release Pu not attack, subject try for jun enter speak, with virtue Wei jun.
translations.idiomatic: Hu Yan said, "My lord should release Pu and not attack it. I will try to go in and speak on your behalf, to win favor with the Lord of Wei."

sentences.zh: 樗里子曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Shu Lizi said: Good.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Lizi replied, "Excellent."

sentences.zh: 胡衍入蒲，謂其守曰：「樗里子知蒲之病矣，其言曰必拔蒲。

translations.literal: Hu Yan entered Pu, told its guard: Shu Lizi know Pu difficulty, his words certainly take Pu.
translations.idiomatic: Hu Yan entered Pu and told its governor, "Shu Lizi understands Pu's difficulties. His words say he will certainly take Pu.

sentences.zh: 衍能令釋蒲勿攻。」

translations.literal: Yan can make him release Pu and not attack."
translations.idiomatic: Yan can compel him to abandon Pu and cease the attack."

sentences.zh: 蒲守恐，因再拜曰：「願以請。」

translations.literal: Pu guard feared, because twice bow said: Wish with request.
translations.idiomatic: The governor of Pu was afraid and bowed twice, saying, "I wish to make this request."

sentences.zh: 因效金三百斤，曰：「秦兵茍退，請必言子於衛君，使子為南面。」

translations.literal: Because presented gold three hundred jin, said: Qin troops if retreat, please certainly speak son to Wei jun, make son south face.
translations.idiomatic: He presented three hundred jin of gold, saying, "If the Qin troops withdraw, I will certainly speak on your behalf to the Lord of Wei and make you face south as a ruler."

sentences.zh: 故胡衍受金於蒲以自貴於衛。

translations.literal: Therefore Hu Yan received gold from Pu to ennoble himself in Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Hu Yan accepted gold from Pu to elevate himself in Wei.

sentences.zh: 於是遂解蒲而去。

translations.literal: Thus he lifted the siege of Pu and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he raised the siege of Pu and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 還擊皮氏，皮氏未降，又去。

translations.literal: He returned and attacked Pishi, but Pishi did not surrender, so he departed again.
translations.idiomatic: He turned back and assaulted Pishi, but Pishi refused to yield, so he departed once more.

translations.literal: Zhao Wang first year, Shu Lizi will attack Pu. Pu guard feared, requested Hu Yan. Hu Yan for Pu told Shu Lizi: Jun attack Pu, for Qin? For Wei? For Wei then good, for Qin then not beneficial. Wei reason become Wei, because Pu. Now attack Pu enter Wei, Wei certainly break follow it. Wei lose Xi He outside without to take, troops weak. Now merge Wei to Wei, Wei certainly strong. Wei strong day, Xi He outside certainly danger. Moreover Qin Wang will observe jun affairs, harm Qin benefit Wei, wang certainly punish jun. Shu Lizi said: What to do? Hu Yan said: Jun release Pu not attack, subject try for jun enter speak, with virtue Wei jun. Shu Lizi said: Good. Hu Yan entered Pu, told its guard: Shu Lizi know Pu difficulty, his words certainly take Pu. Yan can make release Pu not attack. Pu guard feared, because twice bow said: Wish with request. Because presented gold three hundred jin, said: Qin troops if retreat, please certainly speak son to Wei jun, make son south face. Therefore Hu Yan received gold from Pu to self-noble Wei. Then released Pu departed. Returned attacked Pi Shi, Pi Shi not surrender, again departed.

sentences.zh: 昭王七年，樗里子卒，葬于渭南章臺之東。

translations.literal: In the seventh year of King Zhao, Shu Lizi died and was buried east of the Zhangtai Terrace south of the Wei River.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year of King Zhao, Shu Lizi passed away and was interred east of the Zhangtai Terrace south of the Wei River.

sentences.zh: 曰：「後百歲，是當有天子之宮夾我墓。」

translations.literal: Said: After hundred years, this should have Son of Heaven palace flank my tomb.
translations.idiomatic: He said, "A hundred years from now, the palaces of the Son of Heaven should flank my tomb."

sentences.zh: 樗里子疾室在於昭王廟西渭南陰鄉樗裏，故俗謂之樗里子。

translations.literal: Shu Lizi's residence was west of the Zhao Wang Temple in the Yinxiang quarter south of the Wei River in Chuli, hence the common name for him.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Lizi's sickroom was west of the Zhao Wang Temple in the Yinxiang quarter south of the Wei River in Chuli, hence the popular designation for him.

sentences.zh: 至漢興，長樂宮在其東，未央宮在其西，武庫正直其墓。

translations.literal: When the Han dynasty arose, the Changlegong Palace was to its east, the Weiyanggong Palace to its west, and the imperial armory directly faced his tomb.
translations.idiomatic: When the Han dynasty emerged, the Changle Palace stood to its east, the Weiyang Palace to its west, and the imperial arsenal directly confronted his tomb.

sentences.zh: 秦人諺曰：「力則任鄙，智則樗裏。」

translations.literal: Qin proverb: Strength then Ren Bi, wisdom then Chu Li.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin people had a proverb: "For strength, look to Ren Bi; for wisdom, look to Chuli."

translations.literal: Zhao Wang seven years, Shu Lizi died, buried Wei Nan Zhang Tai east. Said: After hundred years, this should have Son of Heaven palace flank my tomb. Shu Lizi disease room at Zhao Wang temple west Wei Nan Yin Xiang Chu Li, therefore custom call Chu Li Zi. To Han rise, Chang Le Palace at its east, Wei Yang Palace at its west, Wu Ku exactly straight its tomb. Qin proverb: Strength then Ren Bi, wisdom then Chu Li.

sentences.zh: 甘茂者，下蔡人也。

translations.literal: Gan Mao was a man of Xiaca.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Mao was a native of Xiaca.

sentences.zh: 事下蔡史舉先生，學百家之說。

translations.literal: He served under Master Shi Ju of Xiaca and studied the doctrines of the Hundred Schools.
translations.idiomatic: He attended Master Shi Ju of Xiaca and mastered the teachings of the Hundred Schools.

sentences.zh: 因張儀、樗里子而求見秦惠王。

translations.literal: Through Zhang Yi and Shu Lizi, he sought an audience with King Hui of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Through Zhang Yi and Shu Lizi, he petitioned for an audience with King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 王見而說之，使將，而佐魏章略定漢中地。

translations.literal: Wang saw pleased him, made general, assisted Wei Zhang roughly pacified Han Zhong land.
translations.idiomatic: The king saw and delighted in him, appointed him general, and had him assist Wei Zhang in roughly pacifying the Han Zhong territory.

translations.literal: Gan Mao, Xia Cai man. Served Xia Cai Shi Ju mister, studied hundred schools sayings. Because Zhang Yi, Shu Lizi sought see Qin Hui Wang. Wang saw pleased him, made general, assisted Wei Zhang roughly pacified Han Zhong land.

sentences.zh: 惠王卒，武王立。

translations.literal: Hui Wang died, Wu Wang established.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui passed away, and King Wu ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章去，東之魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang departed, east to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang departed and went east to Wei.

sentences.zh: 蜀侯煇、相壯反，秦使甘茂定蜀。

translations.literal: Shu Hou Hui, chancellor Zhuang rebelled, Qin made Gan Mao pacify Shu.
translations.idiomatic: The Shu lord Hui and chancellor Zhuang rebelled. Qin dispatched Gan Mao to pacify Shu.

sentences.zh: 還，而以甘茂為左丞相，以樗里子為右丞相。

translations.literal: Returned, made Gan Mao left chancellor, Shu Lizi right chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Upon his return, they appointed Gan Mao as left prime minister and Shu Lizi as right prime minister.

translations.literal: Hui Wang died, Wu Wang established. Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang departed, east to Wei. Shu Hou Hui, chancellor Zhuang rebelled, Qin made Gan Mao pacify Shu. Returned, made Gan Mao left chancellor, Shu Lizi right chancellor.

sentences.zh: 秦武王三年，謂甘茂曰：「寡人欲容車通三川，以窺周室，而寡人死不朽矣。」

translations.literal: Qin Wu Wang three years, told Gan Mao: "I wish broad chariot pass San Chuan, spy Zhou house, I die not rotten."
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of King Wu of Qin, he addressed Gan Mao: 'I desire broad chariots to traverse the Sanchuan and spy upon the Zhou court—then I shall die without decay.'

sentences.zh: 甘茂曰：「請之魏，約以伐韓，而令向壽輔行。」

translations.literal: Gan Mao said: "Request Wei, pact attack Han, make Xiang Shou assist go."
translations.idiomatic: Gan Mao said, "I request to go to Wei, make a pact to attack Han, and have Xiang Shou accompany me."

sentences.zh: 甘茂至，謂向壽曰：「子歸，言之於王曰『魏聽臣矣，然願王勿伐』。

translations.literal: Gan Mao arrived, told Xiang Shou: "You return, speak wang: Wei listen minister, yet wish wang not attack.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Mao arrived and told Xiang Shou: 'Return and speak to the king: "Wei heeds my counsel, yet I wish Your Majesty not to attack."'

sentences.zh: 事成，盡以為子功。」

translations.literal: Affairs complete, all as you merit."
translations.idiomatic: When affairs succeed, I shall attribute all merit to you."

sentences.zh: 向壽歸，以告王，王迎甘茂於息壤。

translations.literal: Xiang Shou returned, told wang, wang welcomed Gan Mao at Xi Rang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Shou returned and informed the king, who welcomed Gan Mao at Xirang.

sentences.zh: 甘茂至，王問其故。

translations.literal: Gan Mao arrived, wang asked its reason.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Mao arrived, and the king inquired about the reason.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「宜陽，大縣也，上黨、南陽積之久矣。

translations.literal: Replied: "Yi Yang, big county, Shang Dang, Nan Yang store long.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Yiyang is a major county. Shangdang and Nanyang have stored up resources there for a long time.'

sentences.zh: 名曰縣，其實郡也。

translations.literal: Named county, actually commandery.
translations.idiomatic: It is called a county in name, but in reality it is a commandery.

sentences.zh: 今王倍數險，行千里攻之，難。

translations.literal: Now wang double several dangers, travel thousand li attack it, difficult.
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty would double several dangers and travel a thousand li to attack it—this is difficult.'

sentences.zh: 昔曾參之處費，魯人有與曾參同姓名者殺人，人告其母曰『曾參殺人』，其母織自若也。

translations.literal: Former Zeng Shen at Fei, Lu man with Zeng Shen same name kill person, person told his mother: Zeng Shen kill person, his mother weave as before.
translations.idiomatic: 'In former times, when Zeng Shen dwelt in Fei, a man from Lu with the same name as Zeng Shen committed murder. Someone told his mother, "Zeng Shen has killed a man," but his mother continued weaving undisturbed.'

sentences.zh: 頃之，一人又告之曰『曾參殺人』，其母尚織自若也。

translations.literal: Shortly, one person again told: Zeng Shen kill person, his mother still weave as before.
translations.idiomatic: Shortly after, another person told her, 'Zeng Shen has killed a man,' and his mother still continued weaving undisturbed.'

sentences.zh: 頃又一人告之曰『曾參殺人』，其母投杼下機，踰墻而走。

translations.literal: Shortly again one person told: Zeng Shen kill person, his mother threw shuttle left loom, crossed wall fled.
translations.idiomatic: Shortly after, yet another person told her, 'Zeng Shen has killed a man,' whereupon his mother threw down her shuttle, left her loom, climbed over the wall, and fled.'

sentences.zh: 夫以曾參之賢與其母信之也，三人疑之，其母懼焉。

translations.literal: Using Zeng Shen worthy with his mother trust him, three men doubt, his mother feared.
translations.idiomatic: Though Zeng Shen was worthy and his mother trusted him completely, when three men doubted him, his mother grew fearful.'

sentences.zh: 今臣之賢不若曾參，王之信臣又不如曾參之母信曾參也，疑臣者非特三人，臣恐大王之投杼也。

translations.literal: Now minister worthy not as Zeng Shen, wang trust minister again not as Zeng Shen mother trust Zeng Shen, doubt minister not only three men, minister fear wang throw shuttle.
translations.idiomatic: 'Now your minister's worthiness does not equal Zeng Shen's, and Your Majesty's trust in your minister does not equal Zeng Shen's mother's trust in Zeng Shen. Those who doubt your minister are not merely three men—I fear Your Majesty will throw down the shuttle.'

sentences.zh: 始張儀西并巴蜀之地，北開西河之外，南取上庸，天下不以多張子而以賢先王。

translations.literal: Initially Zhang Yi west merge Ba Shu land, north open Xi He outside, south take Shang Yong, world not with much Zhang Zi but with worthy former wang.
translations.idiomatic: 'At first Zhang Yi merged the lands of Bashu to the west, opened the territories north of the Yellow River, and seized Shangyong to the south. The world did not attribute this to Master Zhang's greed but to the former king's worthiness.'

sentences.zh: 魏文侯令樂羊將而攻中山，三年而拔之。

translations.literal: Wei Wen Hou make Yue Yang general attack Zhong Shan, three years take it.
translations.idiomatic: 'Marquis Wen of Wei commanded Yue Yang as general to attack Zhongshan, and after three years he captured it.'

sentences.zh: 樂羊返而論功，文侯示之謗書一篋。

translations.literal: When Yue Yang returned and requested reward for his merit, Marquis Wen showed him a box full of slanderous letters.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yang returned and sought reward for his merit. Marquis Wen showed him a casket filled with slanderous letters.'

sentences.zh: 樂羊再拜稽首曰：『此非臣之功也，主君之力也。』

translations.literal: Yue Yang twice bow touched head: This not subject merit, jun effort.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yang bowed twice and touched his head to the ground: 'This is not my merit—it is my lord's strength.'

sentences.zh: 今臣，羈旅之臣也。
